title_html: Join Deep Learning leaders in Boston, May 25-26 – KDnuggets Offer

KDnuggets Home » News » 2017 » Apr » Meetings » Join Deep Learning leaders in Boston, May 25-26 – KDnuggets Offer ( 17:n15 )

Join Deep Learning leaders in Boston, May 25-26 – KDnuggets Offer

Previous post
Next post

 
 
Tags: Boston, Deep Learning, Healthcare, MA, RE.WORK

We're gathering 400+ leading experts and healthcare professionals at the Deep Learning Summit, and Deep Learning in Healthcare Summit in Boston on May 25-26. KDnuggets subscribers get 20% off pass prices for all RE•WORK events with discount code KDNUGGETS.


Deep learning experts share their thoughts on recent advancements

Deep Learning has been called the ‘new electricity’ and is transforming every industry from manufacturing and agriculture to retail and finance. Advancements in natural language processing, reinforcement learning, image retreival and speech recognition have lead to more efficient and precise operations across all sectors. In particular, applications in health and medicine have revolutionised the healthcare sector across the globe.  

We're gathering 400+ leading experts and healthcare professionals at the Deep Learning Summit, and Deep Learning in Healthcare Summit in Boston on May 25 - 26 to discover more about the latest advancements in deep learning and how these are impacting the health sector. 

Discover advances in image & pattern recognition, computer vision, robotics and drug development from the world's leading innovators and industry experts at the dual summit in May.

KDnuggets subscribers get 20% off pass prices for all RE•WORK events. Use the discount code KDNUGGETS to book your place at an upcoming event now.

EXPERTS ON THE DEEP LEARNING SUMMIT AGENDA


We asked a few of the expert speakers their thoughts on the key factors that have enabled recent advancements in deep learning:
  • Charlie Tang, Research Scientist at Apple: I think the availability of compute in the form of GPUs and the availability of datasets/simulators have led to the recent advancements
  • Carl Vondrick, PhD Student at MIT: The availability and the capability to process massive annotated datasets as well as the understanding of how to use large-scale data.
  • Dilip Krishnan, Research Scientist at Google: Better optimization methods (Adam, AdaDelta) and better tools (e.g. Tensorflow, distributed model training) have played a role in allowing for more efficient engineering.

Read more from our speaker interviews here. 

Other confirmed speakers include Andrew Tulloch of Facebook, Nicolas Koumchatzky, Head of Twitter Cortex and Spyros Matsoukas of Amazon.

View further details and the Deep Learning Summit agenda here. 
REGISTER HERE USING DISCOUNT CODE

EXPERTS ON THE DEEP LEARNING IN HEALTHCARE AGENDA


We asked the speakers what deep learning advancements in healthcare would they hope to see in the next 3 years?:
  • Daniel Golden, Machine Learning Lead at Arterys: Recent work on deep learning-based image captioning and text-based image retrieval gives me hope that we’ll soon be able to combine all sources of a patient’s electronic medical record data into one beautiful and efficient model; the most accurate predictive model will surely be the one that can understand the electronic medical record in its entirety.
  • Avanti Shrikumar, PhD Student at Stanford University: I hope to see a lot more intelligent customization of deep learning methods to genomics. My lab recently put out a preprint on accounting for the fact that DNA is double-stranded in our deep learning models - pretty much the simplest domain-specific modification you can think of. We hope it is the first of many in the years to come.

Read more from our speaker interviews here. 

Other confirmed speakers include Junshui Ma of Merck, Fabian Schmich, Data Scientist at Roche and Saman Parvaneh of Philips Research.

View further details and the Deep Learning in Healthcare Summit agenda here. 
REGISTER HERE USING DISCOUNT CODE

BOOK NOW: 20% DISCOUNT


A unique opportunity to interact with business leaders, influential technologists, healthcare professionals & entrepreneurs leading the deep learning revolution. Attending companies include: UnitedHealth Group, Elsevier, Novartis, GSK, Ford, TripAdvisor, AT&T, Microsoft and Thomson Reuters. Don’t miss your place at these summits! 

Use the special KDnuggets discount code: KDNUGGETS to save 20% off your ticket today! Tickets will sell out fast. 

We hope to see you there! However, if you can't make this event upcoming events include: 
  • Machine Intelligence Summit in Amsterdam on 28-29 June
    • includes an additional track on Autonomous Vehicles
  • Deep Learning Summit in London on 21-22 September
    • includes an additional track on Virtual Assistants
  • Deep Learning Summit in Montreal on 10-11 October
    • includes an additional track on Finance
We’ll be recording all presentations & content from the events. If you’d like to view this content, contact Chloe on cpang@re-work.co for membership details.

Nikita

Founder
RE•WORK
@teamrework
hello@re-work.co

title: Join Deep Learning leaders in Boston, May 25-26 – KDnuggets Offer
content_html:
Deep learning experts share their thoughts on recent advancements

Deep Learning has been called the ‘new electricity’ and is transforming every industry from manufacturing and agriculture to retail and finance. Advancements in natural language processing, reinforcement learning, image retreival and speech recognition have lead to more efficient and precise operations across all sectors. In particular, applications in health and medicine have revolutionised the healthcare sector across the globe.  

We're gathering 400+ leading experts and healthcare professionals at the Deep Learning Summit, and Deep Learning in Healthcare Summit in Boston on May 25 - 26 to discover more about the latest advancements in deep learning and how these are impacting the health sector. 

Discover advances in image & pattern recognition, computer vision, robotics and drug development from the world's leading innovators and industry experts at the dual summit in May.

EXPERTS ON THE DEEP LEARNING SUMMIT AGENDA


We asked a few of the expert speakers their thoughts on the key factors that have enabled recent advancements in deep learning:
  • Charlie Tang, Research Scientist at Apple: I think the availability of compute in the form of GPUs and the availability of datasets/simulators have led to the recent advancements
  • Carl Vondrick, PhD Student at MIT: The availability and the capability to process massive annotated datasets as well as the understanding of how to use large-scale data.
  • Dilip Krishnan, Research Scientist at Google: Better optimization methods (Adam, AdaDelta) and better tools (e.g. Tensorflow, distributed model training) have played a role in allowing for more efficient engineering.

Read more from our speaker interviews here. 

Other confirmed speakers include Andrew Tulloch of Facebook, Nicolas Koumchatzky, Head of Twitter Cortex and Spyros Matsoukas of Amazon.
